intro: Struthanthus heterophyllus, commonly known as the variable leaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant exhibits significant morphological variation in leaf shape and size, which is reflected in its scientific name. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and open woodlands. Struthanthus heterophyllus is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers.
